title: Tools to Analyze Economic Data
text: goal econtools provide tools analyzing economic data similar Python bblocks package. package part econdataverse family packages aimed helping economists financial professionals work sovereign-level economic data. Roadmap: Using wbwdi: adding add_population_column(), add_poverty_ratio_column(), add_population_density_column(), add_population_share_column(), add_income_level_column() Using econid: introducing id_type="regex" existing functions adding add_short_names_column(), add_iso3_codes_column() Using imfweo: adding add_gdp_column(), add_gov_expenditure_column(), add_gdp_share_column(), add_gov_exp_share_column()

title: Tools to Analyze Economic Data
text: basic example shows solve common problem: simplest way add additional information using ISO 3166-1 alpha-3 code. Add recent population number: Add population year: Similarly, poverty ratio: Create new column calculates value relative population, instance GDP per capita: Add income levels via: want use another column automatically map identifiers new entity_id column using econid package: want add ISO-3 codes: can also add column standardized names:
code: library(econtools) df <- data.frame(   id = rep("USA", 5),   name = c("United States", "United.states", "US", "USA", "United States"),   year = 2019:2023,   gdp = c(2.15e13, 2.14e13, 2.37e13, 2.60e13, 2.77e13) ) add_population_column(df, id_column = "id") #>    id          name year      gdp population #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13  334914895 #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13  334914895 #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13  334914895 #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13  334914895 #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13  334914895 add_population_column(df, id_column = "id", date_column = "year") #>    id          name year      gdp population #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13  328329953 #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13  331526933 #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13  332048977 #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13  333271411 #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13  334914895 add_poverty_ratio_column(df, id_column = "id", date_column = "year") #>    id          name year      gdp poverty_ratio #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13           1.0 #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13           0.2 #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13           0.2 #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13           1.2 #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13            NA add_population_share_column(   df,   id_column = "id",   date_column = "year",   value_column = "gdp" ) #>    id          name year      gdp population population_share #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13  328329953         65482.91 #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13  331526933         64549.81 #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13  332048977         71375.01 #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13  333271411         78014.49 #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13  334914895         82707.58 add_income_level_column(df, id_column = "id") #>    id          name year      gdp income_level_id income_level_name #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13             HIC       High income #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13             HIC       High income #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13             HIC       High income #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13             HIC       High income #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13             HIC       High income add_population_column(df, id_column = "name", id_type = "regex") #>    id          name year      gdp entity_id population #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13       USA  334914895 #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13       USA  334914895 #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13       USA  334914895 #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13       USA  334914895 #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13       USA  334914895 add_iso3_codes_column(df, "name") #>    id          name year      gdp iso3_code #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13       USA #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13       USA #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13       USA #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13       USA #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13       USA add_short_names_column(df, "name") #>    id          name year      gdp    short_name #> 1 USA United States 2019 2.15e+13 United States #> 2 USA United.states 2020 2.14e+13 United States #> 3 USA            US 2021 2.37e+13 United States #> 4 USA           USA 2022 2.60e+13 United States #> 5 USA United States 2023 2.77e+13 United States

code: # Add population data using ISO3 codes df <- data.frame(country = c("USA", "CAN", "MEX")) result <- add_population_column(df, id_column = "country")  # Add population data with specific dates df <- data.frame(country = c("USA", "CAN"), year = c(2019, 2020)) result <- add_population_column(  df, id_column = "country", date_column = "year" )
